column5: Part of the problem of putting that car through the ice at the Dryden dock, is that is where you get on the ice road and salt off the vehicles tends to melt the ice there. Also was noted that alcohol was involved, imagine that.
Kind of weird watching a video about the "frozen tundra" with background music of some Hawaiian guy singing and playing a ukelele.
I was out at my place on Blue Lk (just southwest of Indian Lk) this am,lots of ice & still tight to shore in some places.Mother Nature needs an A$$ kickin
I love the music! Makes me feel warm at least
Hey Blue LK, doesn't the "Chain" go out before Blue Lake? I've heard Nixon is always the first to go?

Does anyone remember the commercials back in the 70's for Chiffon Margarine? Gee, it's the 2nd of May in mid-Iowa and it's been snowing all day here. Good grief, walleye season opens in 16 days up north. Will the ice be out (especially on the Indian Lake chain near VB for us) or will Mother Nature post the latest opener in history? I don't know, but I wouldn't be surprised if someone blames it on global warming!! :-)Anyway, see the attached pic. I suspect there will be some people who will be looking like this on the opening day!Best Wishes to All,81Saluki
Go figure, it's a nice sunny 73 here in southern Ontario.

With all the interest in the current ice out conditions up here in NW Ontario, I offer this look into past and present conditions in the Vermilion Bay area...... http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XKOH7...layer_embedded
Snowed Tuesday and Wednesday in Winnipeg
Nice compilation V-Bay. This year is certainly an anomaly. Warm weather on its way...question remains ....how intense and for what duration?
6" of snow in thunder bay today...
Well done Gord! Thanks for sharing
Nice video Gord. Is it true someone put their car through the ice at that dock the other day?
